summary: babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers . just as antibiotics are used to make farm animals put on weight , the may also be fattening our children . a third of 10-11 year olds in england are overweight or obese . finnish researchers compared the weight and height of more than 12,000 healthy two year old with records on antibiotic prescription .

aspect: 1. Babies given antibiotics in their first six months have a higher chance of being overweight as toddlers.
2. The study found that antibiotics may contribute to childhood obesity due to their effect on gut bacteria.
3. The over-prescription of antibiotics could lead to antibiotic resistance and harder-to-treat infections.
explain: Babies exposed to antibiotics in their first six months are more likely to be overweight as toddlers, as antibiotics may disrupt the microbiome and contribute to weight gain.
